description: Escherichia coli is the predominant facultative anaerobe of the human colonic flora. The organism typically colonizes the infant gastrointestinal tract within hours of life, and, thereafter, E. coli and the host derive mutual benefit. Most E. coli are harmless are part of the normal microbiota of the gut, and can benefit their hosts by producing vitamin K2 and preventing colonisation of the intestine with pathogenic bacteria.
name: Escherichia coli (E. coli) Antibodies and Antigens
